entry.title: Test Kitchen 1.x
entry.content:
Join our panelists as we discuss Test Kitchen!

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio
    • Video

Panel

  • Fletcher Nichol twitter, github
  • JJ Asghar github, twitter, blog, irc: j2
  • Jonathan Hartman github, twitter, irc: roboticcheese - Jon was able to join us almost long enough to introduce himself ;(
  • Joshua Timberman github, twitter, blog
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • Salim Afiune github, twitter
  • Scott Pustay github, twitter, blog
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

Chef News

Upcoming Events

  • Chef Community Summit - October 2 & 3 - FOODFIGHT saves 10%

  • Chef Community Summit London - October 15 & 16 - FOODFIGHT saves 10%

  • DevOpsDays Chicago - October 7 & 8 - The Food Fight Show is a Media Sponsor code FOODFIGHT10 will save you 10% off!

  • VMWorld - August 24 - 28

  • Chef and Azure Webinar - August 27
  • FlowCon - September 3 & 4
  • Managing Containers with Chef - Webinar - September 10
  • Fossetcon - September 11 - 13
  • Velocity New York - September 15-17
  • PowerShell DSC at Chef-NYC Meetup - September 17
  • Chef Analytics Webinar - September 17
  • Beyond the Code - September 19 in Ottawa Canada

  • PowerShell Summit EU - September 29 through October 1 in Amsterdam, The Netherlands

  • DevOpsDays

    • Toronto - September 12 & 13
    • New York City - September 19
    • Warsaw - September 25 & 26
    • Tel Aviv - September 29 & 30
    • Berlin - October 23 & 24
    • Belgium - October 27 & 28 - Five year anniversary
    • Vancouver - November 14 & 15

Upcoming Chef Training

Use discount code FOODFIGHT to save 10% off upcoming Chef training that's being held in

  • Austin
  • Bangalore
  • Chennai
  • Denver
  • Phoenix
  • Raleigh
  • San Francisco
  • Seattle

There are also a number of classes being offered online.

Show Notes

Here's a brief outline of some of the things we'd like to discuss. Add your ideas to the show notes.

  • kitchen.ci
    • What is Test Kitchen?
    • Why Test Kitchen?
    • Walk us through a .kitchen.yml file
    • How does one get started with Test Kitchen?
    • How does one extend Test Kitchen?
    • Terms
      • driver
      • provisioner
      • platforms
      • suites
      • bussers; and the magic behind them
  • How are the Chef Development Kit and Test Kitchen related?
  • Interesting use cases for test-kitchen. Leveraging drivers to do development in the cloud when local machine restrictions won't allow for vagrant/vmware.
  • Does TK have any support for evaluating idempotence and/or run performance?
    • Testing Idempotence for Infrastructure as Code
  • Test Kitchen & Windows Guest? Uhmmm is that possible?
  • How do bussers work? Are they run from the host machine or on the machine under test?
  • Chef Cookbook Development Workflow RFC

Picks

Fletcher

  • ChefSpec
  • The Goal, especially the audio book version
  • Walking (the exercise, you know, get up from your desk)

JJ

  • Sean O'Meara: Cookbook Unit and Acceptance Testing
  • The Game of Thrones board game
  • Cold Brew Coffee

Jonathan

  • The Wirecutter
  • CircleCI
  • Tom Duffield's Chef-Container Talk

Joshua

  • RFC - Homebrew As OS X Default Package Provider
  • Chef Issue - Homebrew As OS X Default Package Provider
  • Homebrew Cask
  • The Complete Joy of Homebrewing
  • Chef reporting API and the knife-reporting gem

Salim

  • Moonwalking with Einstein

Scott

  • Little sumpin' from Lagunitas

Mike

  • Blue Apron

Nathen

  • Chef Developers' IRC Meetings
  • Taking a proper vacation: leave your phone and computer at home.
  • Not being an asshole on social media or anywhere else, for that matter.

Download

  • Audio
  • Video

The Food Fight Show is brought to you by Bryan Berry and Nathen Harvey with help from other hosts and the awesome community of Chefs.

The show is sponsored, in part, by Chef.

Feedback, suggestions, and questions: info@foodfightshow.com or http://github.com/foodfight/showz.

entry.title: Immutable Infrastructure
entry.content:
Show Date: July 22, 2013

Join us as we discuss Immutable Infrastructure with Chad Fowler.

This episode was inspired by Chad's recent blog post on Immutable Infrastructure. For some additional thoughts on the subject, check-out Mike Fiedler's #ChefConf talk: Treating Your Infrastructure Like Garbage.

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Chef News
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio
    • Video

Panel

  • Chad Fowler twitter, github, blog
  • Craig Tracey twitter, github, blog
  • Fletcher Nichol twitter, github
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • Ranjib Dey github, twitter, blog
  • Bryan Berry github, twitter, irc: bryanwb, blog: devopsanywhere
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Chef News

  • DevOps Toolbox: Introduction - a series of blog posts from Christopher Laco that walks through many tools used with Chef. The series starts with installing pre-requisites like XCode, Ruby, and VirtualBox. Throughout the series, you'll learn about Veewee, Vagrant, Chef Solo, Hosted Chef, and more!

  • Gusteau - a tasteful Chef Solo wrapper and configuration manager. This is a gem that aims to provide chef solo users with a more efficent workflow. It looks like an abstraction on top of Vagrant, Berkshelf, and Chef that makes it easier to get started with these various tools.

  • kitchen-docker

Outline

  • Chef News
  • Introductions
  • Chad Fowler: Trash Your Servers and Burn Your Code: Immutable Infrastructure and Disposable Components
  • Article Summary
  • Changing Servers (Process)
  • Repackaging AMIs
  • Garbage Collection
  • Autoscaling
  • Servers
  • Amazon RDS
  • cassandra
  • zookeeper
  • Riak
  • Classes of Servers
  • RDS Performance
  • Making Changes on the Server
  • Termination Protection
  • 6Wunderkinder: Wunderlist
  • Golden Image System
  • Pulling from Code Repos
  • AMI vs Configuration Management
  • Rebuilding AMIS
  • Optimization
  • Immutable Properties
  • Handling Infrastructure Emergencies
  • Homeostasis
  • Keeping Log Files
  • kitchen-docker
  • Log Rotation

Picks

Brandon

  • AskHistorians Reddit

Bryan

  • Revolution in Storage - RICON East 2013
  • Services Platform: Experiments in OTP-Compliant Dataflow Programming

Chad

  • #shitfire on Freenode IRC

Craig

  • Openstack bare metal provider with cloud init
  • Opscode's Omnibus project

Fletcher

  • Mike's #ChefConf talk
  • The Passionate Programmer
  • Alice in Chains latest album - The Devil Put Dinosaurs Here

Mike

  • code school
  • Code Climate
  • Sprout

Nathen

  • Vacation!
  • Flight Carrier Landing Practice
  • Ship Show Podcast with Sandi Metz - Practical Object OO (and Cat!) Design with Sandi Metz!

Ranjib

  • Chomsky hierarchy
  • Chimay Blue Cap

entry.title: Community Summit Day Two
entry.content:
Show Date: Wednesday, October 24

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Download

Panel

  • Fletcher Nichol github, twitter
  • Seth Vargo github, twitter
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter
  • Jeff Hulten github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

Nathen sits down with Fletcher Nichol (@fnichol), Seth Vargo (@sethvargo), Mike Fiedler (@mikefiedler), and Jeff Hulten (@jhulten) to talk about day two of the Chef Community Summit. We meant to chat for about 20 minutes but this conversation ended taking about an hour. Enjoy!

Topics include:

  • Google+ Hangouts
  • Bug smashing
  • Contributing to the new Docs Site
  • Cookbook Curation
  • Cookbook Name Squatting
  • TDDing tmux
  • Workflow and versioning cookbooks
  • Commitments to make knife plugins installable with knife
  • Exception Handlers

Session Summaries

Follow all the updates from the summit on the Opscode Wiki

Download

Download Chef Summit Day Two Recap - Download here
